channel.title: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command
channel.description:
[move]Possible hidden noclip secret? :eek:[/move]
When I was making a client (private client). I was searching through some classes that I can modify or find new things that Jagex put. And when I was searching through Class21.java (Deob363) I found this: [code]for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)[/code] Now that's the same exact line straight under the ::noclip command and I thought they might be related since ::noclip was an if statment. But I don't know since I'm still learning java. [b]BUT[/b]. I went searching down further in the Class21.java file and found this deeper down in the file: [code] { System.out.println("Warning unsupported wall type"); return true; }[/code] Do you think this has to do with noclip? So I thought there would be more to find deeper down the file but all I found was a bunch of numbers like:
-23 -121 -45 (these are all randomly typed just for an example).
Also numbers like this: 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1, ,1 (again all randomly typed for a example).
Well, tell me what you think of this and if it could be a relationship between the ::noclip command, and this discovery.

item.title: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

The noclip command efficiently enables the client to parse and clear clipped regions which it has knowledge of. Chances are you WONT be banned for doing this… But it wont work either way, just screw up your client.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command

item.description:
@quazzymodem wrote:

well u can and i have been nocliping in actual rs and i have logged into a banned acc (only for about 5 mins and i couldnt move or do anthing) but i cant give my client that alows this yet…on a side not dont bother telling me that its imposible to do what i just said i did cos i dont care i no i did and thats what matters =]

item.title: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

No this is not a secret. The wall types are used in pathing and in map rendering.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command

item.title: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Modify/comment out things in Class21.java untill you figure out what things do. You never know when you may find something.

{ System.out.println("Warning unsupported wall type"); return true; }

I have no idea what that means. Good luck figuring it out.

Read full topic

item.title: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command
item.dc:creator: @Someone Someone
item.description:
@Someone wrote:

[quote=“Dizzy, post:1, topic:444”][move]Possible hidden noclip secret? :eek:[/move]

When I was making a client (private client). I was searching through some classes that I can modify or find new things that Jagex put. And when I was searching through Class21.java (Deob363) I found this:

for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)

Now that’s the same exact line straight under the ::noclip command and I thought they might be related since ::noclip was an if statment. But I don’t know since I’m still learning java. BUT. I went searching down further in the Class21.java file and found this deeper down in the file:

{ System.out.println("Warning unsupported wall type"); return true; }
Do you think this has to do with noclip?
So I thought there would be more to find deeper down the file but all I found was a bunch of numbers like:

-23
-121
-45 (these are all randomly typed just for an example).

Also numbers like this:
1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1, ,1 (again all randomly typed for a example).

Well, tell me what you think of this and if it could be a relationship between the ::noclip command, and this discovery.[/quote]Well to my knowledge there’s a game i like to hack called Gunz, in that game there is something called a “no clip hack” bassically what this does is let you walk through walls, scince the game i play is an online multiplayer shooter its funny to do it cause ppl go “omfg hacker hacker!” any ways my point is that in this game you can shoot ppl and when they try to shoot at you they can see u because ur behind a wall and all u see is a wall and if they do find out where you are they cannot hurt u because they will just shoot the wall instead of you, but grenades can hurt you because it has a splash effect.hopefully this helped you out somehow.

Read full topic

item.title: A possible hidden secret about the ::noclip command
item.dc:creator: @bentski bentski
item.description:
@bentski wrote:

::noclip removes client’s side path finder
and if you are one of jagex staff this removes clipping server side
